cluster_classes.class_description: Defensive behaviors in which caterpillars visually blend into their environment, including general camouflage and specific mimicry of plant parts such as twigs and leaves.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Some caterpillars ... mimic the appearance of twigs or leaves to camouflage themselves from predators.

members.entity_description: Defensive strategy where caterpillars visually blend into surroundings to avoid predators.
Caterpillar camouflage strategy where individuals resemble twigs.
Caterpillar camouflage strategy in which individuals resemble leaves.

cluster_classes.class_description: Physical parts of plants that serve as environmental structures for caterpillar behavior or camouflage, such as attachment sites or visual backgrounds.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Leaves, stems, and twigs are plant parts used as background or attachment points.

members.entity_description: Plant leaves that are visually imitated by certain caterpillars for concealment.
Plant stem that serves as an attachment point for the caterpillar before forming a chrysalis.
Small plant branches whose appearance is mimicked by some caterpillars.

args.new_description: Defensive behavioral adaptations in which caterpillars visually blend into their environment, including general background matching and specific mimicry of plant parts such as twigs and leaves.
args.justification: Entities in this class are all caterpillar behaviors (camouflage, twig mimicry, leaf mimicry) and should be grouped under a broader class group shared with related environmental features while clarifying that this class specifically covers behavioral strategies.

args.new_description: Physical plant parts (e.g., leaves, stems, twigs) that serve as environmental structures or visual backgrounds for caterpillar behavior and camouflage.
args.justification: Members (leaves, stem, twigs) are plant structures that function as the environmental substrates/backgrounds for the camouflage behaviors in the related class, so they should share a class group while this class's label/description are refined to emphasize their role in camouflage.

executed_decisions.justification: Members (leaves, stem, twigs) are plant structures that function as the environmental substrates/backgrounds for the camouflage behaviors in the related class, so they should share a class group while this class's label/description are refined to emphasize their role in camouflage.
